results.abstract: When you’ve acted, directed, written, produced, married, divorced, mothered and sold lipstick, what do you do next in America? Host a talk show, of course.
results.title: Drew Barrymore Is Keeping It Clean

multimedia.caption: Of her TV demeanor, Ms. Barrymore said, “I gravitate toward a Julia Child or a Lucille Ball rather than trying to do it perfect.”

results.abstract: A 1976 TV movie that imagined years as people is a helpful reminder that a new page on the calendar is an arbitrary creation.

results.title: Tanya Roberts, a Charlie’s Angel and a Bond Girl, Is Dead at 65
results.abstract: After finding stardom in the 1980s, she fell out of the spotlight until re-emerging in 1998 in the sitcom “That ’70s Show.”

results.byline: By A.O. Scott and Manohla Dargis
results.title: This Year Was a Disaster. We Hope the Sequel Is Better.
results.abstract: We streamed, we watched, we worried. We also wondered what the catastrophe called 2020 will mean for movies.

results.title: Vanessa Kirby Has Been Waiting for a Role That Scares Her
results.abstract: For her first lead in a film, the actress wanted a character as challenging as many of those she’s played onstage. She found it in Kornel Mundruczo’s “Pieces of a Woman.”

results.title: The Bruce Willis Journey From In Demand to On Demand
results.abstract: An assessment of the actor’s late-career B-movie filmography, including his most recent entry, “Breach.”

results.title: Stream These 8 Titles Before They Leave Netflix This Month
results.abstract: After the end-of-year bloodletting, the losses are a little lighter in January. But there are still some great gems worth catching.

results.title: Joe Clark, Tough Principal at New Jersey High School, Dies at 82
results.abstract: Bullhorn in hand, he roamed the hallways as he imposed discipline, expelling “miscreants” and restoring order. Morgan Freeman portrayed him in the film “Lean on Me.”

results.title: Wonder Woman and Her Evolving Look
results.abstract: She remained steadfast in her decades-long fight for justice, but her costumes ranged from a golden-eagle emblem and skirt to a W logo breastplate and leggings.

results.title: Reviewing a Wild Year in Art With the ‘Culture Gabfest’

results.title: For His Second Act, Nnamdi Asomugha Made Preparation His Byword
results.abstract: The former pro football player has pushed himself in acting classes, onstage and in films. His latest drama, “Sylvie’s Love,” also meant returning to an early passion: music.
